column4: Hello! I've just installed (after much toil) Ubuntu on a friend's computer. I set up a dual-boot for him on two partitions (the other is Windows XP Home). The only problem I had with installing was that the keyboard, regardless of what I did, would not work while using the Edgy i386 LiveCD. I got around that obstacle by copy/pasting information and changing stuff later via the mouse, but now that it's installed the keyboard on
It seemed to cut off your chat line, so I don't know what the problem is that you're having with the keyboard.
ohh sory. the keyboard doesn't work often (roughly 12.5% of the time) and the system sometimes restarts when I select Ubuntu in GRUB
and the keyboard didn't work at all in the LiveCD
That's odd. I can't think of any reason for a PS/2 keyboard to stop working.

I would suspect it to be a hardware problem, but it works fine and consistently in windows. could it be a problem with how the kernel is interfacing with the (apparently at least a little bit broken) hardware?
How old is the computer? Has it had hardware problems in the past? Are other keyboards (USB or such) installed?

it's about three years old. I'm not sure if you got this part of my message: "The only semi-relevant problem I know of is that his BIOS thinks there's something wrong with his CPU and he has to press F1 every time he boots to get past a weird diagnostic screen."
oh and it's a pentium 4 so nothing strange there. he's not sure what's wrong with it or when the error started occurring
That could be it.. I dunno. Have you tried other keyboards with it? The problem with the CPU sounds odd, too.
I wouldn't be surprised if the CPU error is related to the keyboard error.
really? I was thinking that but I'm not extremely good with hardware problems so I wasn't really sure. I might just try it out with a new processor, then. thanks!
I'm no expert on hardware. Have you tried posting on the forums?
Sounds like a pretty unique problem, then. More than likely something somewhere is damaged. But it's not good to have a less-than-perfectly operating CPU. I think most people would agree. :P
yeah. haha. oh well. I think I have an old P4 lying around that I can loan him for experimentation. if not, I think they're pretty cheap nowadays anyway.
